title: Integrating Technology in Mathematics Education: Short-Intensive Course Based on Blended and Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course teaching methods of integrating technology into mathematics education for undergraduate social science majors, conducted in environments where digital devices (tablets/laptops) are provided

learning_goals: Learners submit a blended/flipped math lesson plan within a week meeting: (1) ≥3 pre-learning videos, (2) ≥2 in-person activities, and (3) learning outcome measurement via rubric.
Simulate and visualize the mathematics problem-solving process using AI-based tools (e.g., GeoGebra, Wolfram Alpha)

Learners analyze 3 math lesson cases using the TPACK framework’s 7 knowledge domains (TK, PK, CK, TPK, TCK, PCK, TPACK), write technology integration effectiveness reports, and achieve ≥4/5 evaluation criteria.

resources: Zoom Account & Real-Time Video Lecture Tools
Math Education Software Licenses (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
